summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center memorandum detailing the response to an incident where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found on the floor of his cell in the Special Housing Unit after reportedly attempting to hang himself. Staff found him unresponsive but breathing, placed him in restraints, and transported him out of the unit on a stretcher.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who reportedly attempted to hang himself in his cell in the Special Housing Unit. He was found on the floor, snoring and unresponsive to commands, and was restrained and transported on a stretcher.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: An officer who was already at the scene when the reporting officer arrived, had placed restraints on Epstein, and assisted in the response.

connections.description: The officer was responding to an incident involving inmate Epstein and assisted in restraining and transporting him.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt Response
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, staff responded to a disturbance in the Special Housing Unit. Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found on the floor of his cell after reportedly attempting to hang himself. He was unresponsive but snoring. Officers restrained him and transported him out of the unit on a stretcher.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The incident occurred at approximately 1:27 AM in the Special Housing Unit (9 South, M Tier) of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Jeffrey Epstein (Inmate #76318-054) was reported to have attempted to hang himself.
Upon arrival, officers found Epstein on the floor of his cell, snoring and appearing to be asleep, and unresponsive to verbal commands.
Officers placed restraints on Epstein and, after unsuccessful attempts to rouse him, retrieved a stretcher to transport him out of the unit.
Epstein was secured on the stretcher and transported out of the Special Housing Unit into an awaiting elevator.
